definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
a Chinese foot/one-third of a meter/a ruler/a tape-measure/one of the three acupoints for measuring pulse in Chinese medicine/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3]
one of the characters used to represent a musical note in gongche notation, 工尺譜|工尺谱[gong1 che3 pu3]

sentences.english: The Ruler body shape is usually equally thin from bottom to top.
sentences.chinese: 直尺型身材通常上下身均瘦。

sentences.english: Use the ruler and the feeler to inspect whether the joint surface of the cylinder head is deformed.
sentences.chinese: 利用直尺和塞尺檢查氣缸頭的結合面是否有變形。

sentences.english: At breast height, measure the trunk diameter by a ruler.
sentences.chinese: 在胸部高度的位置，用一把直尺量度幹徑。

sentences.english: Put the ruler in the pencil case.

sentences.chinese: 那是什麼？那是一個直尺。

sentences.english: She lined the white paper with a pen and a ruler.
sentences.chinese: 她用鋼筆和直尺在白紙上畫線。

sentences.english: There is a pen, a ruler and two books on the desk.
sentences.chinese: 桌上有一支鋼筆，一把直尺和兩本書。

sentences.english: He holds a ruler and clatters about with little dancing steps.
sentences.chinese: 他拿着一根直尺，走着小舞步發出咔噠咔噠的聲音。

sentences.english: The teacher came into the classroom, a rule in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 老師走進教室，手裏拿着一把直尺。

sentences.english: The teacher came in and a ruler was in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 老師走進教室，手裏拿着一把直尺。

sentences.english: Chuck Norris can measure his weight with a ruler.
sentences.chinese: 羅禮士可以用直尺量出他的體重。

sentences.english: Jacob used a ruler to draw straight lines.
sentences.chinese: 雅各習慣用一把直尺劃直線。

definition: set square (tool to measure right angles)
felt-tip pen/roller ball pen/gel ink pen
